title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message:
Similar to my other recent post except no video internal or external. No image or backlight. 
This was a fully working MacBook that had a cracked display. Customer brought into a local shop that replaced the display resulting in this. Caps lights up, fans spin, in-line meter appears to show the Mac is on. 
Disp connector on board/display side board and cable all look good (no charring on 43 & 1). Difference with this one is PP3v3/ [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S0SW_LCD[/SIGNAL_NAMES] are at 0v. 

Went ahead and replaced [CHIPS]u8950[/CHIPS] with some change in values but no change in function. Values before and after are below. 

1) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_AUXCH_C_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES] - 0.693 > 0.469
3) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_AUXCH_C_P[/SIGNAL_NAMES] - 0.693 > 0.464
7) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<0> - 0.420 > 0.378
9) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_P[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<0> - 0.418 > 0.379
13) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<1> - 0.418 > 0.379
15) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_P[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<1> - 0.417 > 0.379
19) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<2> - 0.422 > 0.380
21) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_P[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<2 - 0.416 > 0.378
25) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<3> 0.416 > 0.380
27) [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_ML_P[/SIGNAL_NAMES]<3> - 0.416 > 0.380
4) [SIGNAL_NAMES]BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN[/SIGNAL_NAMES] - 0.726 > 0.718

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video

<s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message: You should get some voltage pulse on LCD connector power rails at least in first seconds.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message:
I do not get any pulse on PP3v3/ [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S0SW_LCD[/SIGNAL_NAMES] with display connected or without. I do get PP3v3/ <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S5[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. [/INST]</s> on [CHIPS]u8500[/CHIPS]/01 and other S0 rails. 

Does this point to [CHIPS]u8500[/CHIPS]/01/10 for creation of [SIGNAL_NAMES]S0SW_LCD[/SIGNAL_NAMES]?

message:
Does that have firmware? You don't seem very optimistic.. 
Worth trying u9800 first?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message:
PCH should first (temporary) enable power for LCD and waits [SIGNAL_NAMES]DP_INT_HPD[/SIGNAL_NAMES] confirmation from it.
PCH has no firmware, but requires clean ME BIOS after changed is done.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message: I can do ME Region but only have 00281 parts board.. all donors don’t have this. Will that work?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00928[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00928 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 whose model number is A1707 with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3162 [/INST]</s> No video
message:
Check Intel marking code on PCH; something like SR30W, etc...
You can buy new, or remove from any other board (nor only Apple brand).
